remarks: This version of ~ dfsb7 does not require that ` ph ` and ` z ` be distinct.  This permits it to be used as a definition for substitution in a formalization that omits the logically redundant axiom ~ ax-5 i.e. that doesn't have the concept of a variable not occurring in a wff. ( ~ df-sb is also suitable, but its mixing of free and bound variables is distasteful to some logicians.)  (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2006.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.)
statement:
sb7h.1 $e |- ( ph -> A. z ph ) $.
sb7h $p |- ( [ y / x ] ph <-> E. z ( z = y /\ E. x ( x = z /\ ph ) ) ) $.
$d y z $.
